c742bb9b-d433-4e08-9fe2-c3382391796b.description: The Agile Essentials badge represents the core Agile fundamentals necessary to effectively function in an Agile role. As such, it assumes that the individual possesses the necessary skillset to operate in a single Agile team utilizing the Scrum or Kanban Agile frameworks, and not in a scaled agile framework setting.
c742bb9b-d433-4e08-9fe2-c3382391796b.name: Agile Acumen - Essentials

badge_template_activities.title: OPTION 1 (Preferred): Agile Foundations - Virtual Instructor led Class. This course covers the foundations of agile, benefits of agile, and the theory and practices of Scrum.
OPTION 2: Agile Foundations – Self Study. This course covers the same content as the instructor led Agile Foundations course, but it is meant to be done at your own pace.

Agile Foundations Assessment: Upon passing you will receive an email from Accredible, a digital credentialing platform. This will include a link to a digital completion certificate and OTU certification badge.
Understand and practice the four (4) core values of the Agile Manifesto​.
Understand and practice the twelve (12) Agile Principles based on the Agile Manifesto.
Attend Agile Scrum events for at least 1 sprint cycle. See attached document for more details.

48198711-0bcc-405d-8b56-ba85b01b7686.description: At this knowledge level the Business Analyst can use their skills in analyzing elicitation results to find the best possible way to represent them in an understandable and eligible method for stakeholders. When working on the requirements, the Business Analyst can define the structure to support all the representation forms decided upon.
48198711-0bcc-405d-8b56-ba85b01b7686.name: Business Analysis: Requirements Analysis / Design - Practical

badge_template_activities.title: Understand some, but not all, of the factors that influence/determine the need for change.
Can participate in activities to define the necessary conditions to meet the business need, with clear direction from others.

Have a basic knowledge of and can follow instructions for common techniques such as:​ Business Case, Document Analysis, ​Functional Decomposition, ​Conceptual Diagraming, ​Basic UML techniques,​ and Process Analysis

0ad35417-8996-4cbb-bcde-b5e2e89cf087.description: At this knowledge level the Business Analyst can independently prepare simple elicitation activities. They may reply on support from others in more complex situations and to manage elicitation activity logistics. They have an awareness of common elicitation techniques including brainstorming, document analysis, interviewing, stakeholder analysis. They can elicit information relevant to the change with support of others and capture the outcomes of the elicitation activities.
0ad35417-8996-4cbb-bcde-b5e2e89cf087.name: Business Analysis: Requirements Elicitation / Collaboration - Practical

badge_template_activities.title: Independently prepare for simple elicitation activities; relies on support from others in more complex situations.
Rely on others to manage elicitation activity logistics.
Have an awareness of common elicitation techniques including (Brainstorming, Document Analysis, Interviewing, Stakeholder Analysis)
Can elicit information relevant to the change with support of others.
Capture the outcomes of the elicitation activity​.

29704c41-337b-449f-bc3e-c16c0a4728f9.description: A Proficient Full Stack Engineer executes independently with minimal guidance and support. This skill level maps to an independent contributor who takes bottom-line responsibility for creating user stories, developing full-stack modules, sharing knowledge, and enforcing coding best practices through code reviews. Individuals in this proficiency level should deliver tangible software development modules while adhering to software quality metrics.
29704c41-337b-449f-bc3e-c16c0a4728f9.name: Full Stack Engineer - Proficient

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully Complete 5 Percipio courses in Proficient Full Stack Engineering Channel.
Independently author a technical user story.
Champion user story creation through creativity, design, and documentation to complete at least 75 user story points.

Successfully deliver 25 code artifacts in the below-listed technologies. These artifacts must be reviewed and accepted as CI/CD pull requests. Front End Technologies - react, angular, jquery, HTML, and CSS. Back End Technologies -- Node.JS, Spring Boot, Java, Express. Collaborate with Devops team to assist in CI/CD automation. Database Technologies -- DDL, DML, PL/SQL or relevant DB code.
Demonstrate the ability to fix at least 25 code scan issues (High/Medium) like CodeQL / SonarQube.
Showcase the ability to fix critical production defects independently.
Work Independently on Proof of Concept effort
Ensure code quality by designing at least 8 different test cases for different functionalities. Execute testing using the JUnit framework while ensuring at least 5 pull requests are accepted.
Demonstrate proactive help to another team member or members from other teams in issue resolution. Find opportunities to share knowledge in a team environment such as lunch and learn sessions.
Create how-to technology documentation and ensure traceability.

3cdaf833-752c-4cde-a7a0-4dc49aaca8bf.description: A Strategic Full-Stack engineer executes at an expert level while evangelizing the software development, operations processes, and team. This role maps to a technology leadership role that makes architecture and design trade-off decisions to deliver a full-stack, scalable and performant end-to-end solution. Individuals with this proficiency level should create design principles and best practice guidance to evangelize full-stack engineers throughout the software development lifecycle.
3cdaf833-752c-4cde-a7a0-4dc49aaca8bf.name: Full Stack Engineer - Strategic

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully Complete 5 Percipio courses related to Advanced Full Stack Engineering technologies mentioned in Strategic Full Stack Engineering Channel.

Complete a capstone project that leverages both front end and back-end technologies into a scalable full stack application and publish these projects through your GitHub repository to share your skills with your peers and technical leadership team.

Play a role of a Technical Lead / Subject Matter Expert and design the solution for at least 5 business/technical projects showcasing skills like strategic planning, Analytical thinking, problem solving and time management.
Champion user story creation through creativity, design, and documentation to complete at least 200 user story points.
Independently author technical user stories.

Successfully deliver 50 code artifacts in the below-listed technologies. These artifacts must be reviewed and accepted as CI/CD pull requests. Front End Technologies - react, angular, jquery, HTML, and CSS etc. Back End Technologies -- Node.JS, Spring Boot, Java, Express etc. Collaborate with Devops team to assist in CI/CD automation. Database Technologies -- DDL, DML, PL/SQL or relevant DB code
Demonstrate the ability to fix at least 30 code scan issues (High/Medium) like CodeQL and SonarQube.
Demonstrate proactive help to team members or other teams in issue resolution. Find opportunities to share knowledge in a team environment such as lunch and learn sessions and developer forums.
Create how-to technology documentation and ensure traceability.

186ec8b3-ee7f-4e95-a7e3-7375659b5e95.description: At this knowledge level the Business Analyst can understand organization’s capabilities, processes, utilized technology, infrastructure policies, business rules business architecture, and external influencers. They can demonstrate the ability to incorporate business and industry knowledge into work and articulate business goals and objectives. They can determine solution scope, define current and future state of business processes, and evaluate business needs by developing various documents.
186ec8b3-ee7f-4e95-a7e3-7375659b5e95.name: Business Analysis: Requirements Analysis / Design - Proficient

badge_template_activities.title: Identify and define the real business needs.
Understand the organization’s capabilities and processes, ​utilized technology and infrastructure, ​policies and business rules​, business architecture​, and internal assets.
Understands external influencers.
Demonstrate the ability to incorporate business and industry knowledge into work.
Articulate business goals and objectives.
Determine the solution scope.
Evaluate business needs through development of: Business Case, ​Document Analysis​, Functional Decomposition​, Conceptual Diagraming, ​Basic UML techniques​, and Process Analysis

f488409f-fd5f-4a25-b55f-6e8d73569c30.description: At this knowledge level the Business Analyst can consistently influence business policies and practices. They can develop approaches and tactics for developing greater organizational understanding and create new ways to identify all potential alternatives to address business needs. They can apply foresight to remove roadblocks that might lead to a negative consequence. They can identify potential changes to support new capabilities, business processes, and technology to support future state.
f488409f-fd5f-4a25-b55f-6e8d73569c30.name: Business Analysis: Requirements Analysis / Design - Strategic

badge_template_activities.title: Consistently influence business policies and practices.
Develop approaches and tactics for developing greater organizational understanding.
Create new ways to identify all potential alternatives to address business needs.
Develop an innovative approach for using new tools, templates and processes that: explain the rationale for adoption and invite intentional feedback and opinions from others.
Apply foresight to identify and overcome potential roadblocks that might lead to a negative consequence.

Identify constraints, potential changes to organizational structure and culture required to support the desired change, new or modified capabilities and business processes, new or modified technology and infrastructure, new or modified organizational policies and business rules required to support the change, and assumptions related to the future state.
Develop and proactively drive adoption of tools, templates, and processes for risk analysis and management.
Leverage historical data to assess the impact and likelihood of risks occurring for the current change.
Apply insight and business acumen when connecting concepts as they relate to different aspects of the enterprise.
Consistently apply risk models that are suitable to the situation.
Coach others on how to assess situations in order to make the most informed decisions about which course of action to pursue.
Guide others on how to effectively use common techniques.

8254bef1-763b-4706-a7e5-9f5ff59e763e.description: At this knowledge level the Business Analyst can understand the scope of the elicitation effort and select appropriate elicitation techniques for the stakeholders. They can prepare supporting materials to convey information (Activity Diagrams, Process Flows, Conceptual Diagrams, etc). Organize activities and manage time efficiently to consistently adhere to commitments and changing priorities. Be able to lead stakeholders for a certain purpose.
8254bef1-763b-4706-a7e5-9f5ff59e763e.name: Business Analysis: Requirements Elicitation / Collaboration - Proficient

badge_template_activities.title: Understand the scope of the elicitation effort.
Select appropriate elicitation techniques for the stakeholders.
Prepare supporting materials (diagrams, visuals etc.) to convey information: Activity Diagrams, Process Flows, Conceptual Diagrams, Use Cases

Prepare stakeholders in advance of elicitation sessions to ensure activities run smoothly and everyone works toward a common goal using methods such as: gaining agreement for required stakeholder commitments, monitoring stakeholder engagement and collaboration, demonstrating collaborative relationships with key stakeholders.
Organize activities and manage time efficiently to consistently adhere to commitments and changing priorities.
Use common elicitation techniques (Brainstorming, Document Analysis, Interviewing, Stakeholder Analysis)
Be able to lead stakeholders for a certain purpose.
Adapt verbal and non-verbal communication style to the needs of the situation and the individual.
Use active listening and discovery skills to understand “real” issues/needs and build rapport.
Use facilitation skills to encourage participation from all attendees.
Influence others to drive action.
Put all the pieces together to elicit information relevant to the change.

634a3659-54ff-447e-b182-962c2dd7165f.description: At this knowledge level the BA can develop approaches and tactics for greater organizational understanding. Been sought for advice, support, and training by others to prepare for elicitation. Work with multiple teams that span functions, issues, and locations to coordinate roles, responsibilities, and interdependencies of all team member. Guide/lead others in elicitation activities. Finds common ground between viewpoints. Define strategies and plans for influencing multiple decision makers.
634a3659-54ff-447e-b182-962c2dd7165f.name: Business Analysis: Requirements Elicitation / Collaboration - Strategic

badge_template_activities.title: Create elicitation support material templates for others to use.
Develop approaches and tactics for developing greater organizational understanding.
Consistently prepare for complex elicitation activities.
Foster a collaborative approach to encourage feedback, opinions and acceptance towards the use of elicitation tools and templates for personal planning and organization.
Have been sought for advice, support and training by others on ways to effectively prepare for elicitation.
Quickly understand team capabilities and skill/knowledge gaps.
Evaluate what worked in previous elicitation activities, what did not, and what could be done differently next time.
Anticipate possible delays and proactively ask for assistance in reprioritizing.
Work with large or multiple teams that span functions, issues, locations, and time zones to coordinate roles, responsibilities and interdependencies of all team member
Use a wide variety of sources to self-assess strengths/weaknesses.
Support others with complex elicitation activities.
Guide others on how to effectively use common elicitation techniques.
Lead others in elicitation activities.
Consistently uncover emotional drivers of stakeholders and develop messaging accordingly.
Develop nontraditional ideas for elicitation techniques.
Consistently find “common ground” between differing viewpoints.
Define strategies and plans for influencing multiple decision makers.

8b83c71d-2b73-4a53-a78f-d22a91fa0622.description: A Practical Full Stack Engineer executes with internal guidance and support. This skill level maps to an individual contributor role with proven skills in front-end and back-end design, development, testing, debugging, and DevOps processes. Individuals in this proficiency level should demonstrate strong communication, collaboration, and coordination skills across software development roles.
8b83c71d-2b73-4a53-a78f-d22a91fa0622.name: Full Stack Engineer - Practical

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully Complete 3 Percipio courses in Practical Full Stack Engineering Channel.
Champion user story creation through creativity, design and documentation to complete at least 10 user story points.

Successfully deliver 5 code artifacts in the below-listed technologies. These artifacts must be reviewed and accepted as CI/CD pull requests. Front End Technologies - react, angular, jquery, HTML, and CSS. Back End Technologies -- Node.JS, Spring Boot, Java, Express Collaborate with Devops team to assist in CI/CD automation. Use a script (Shell, Bash, Python ,Jpac etc.) to automate a task. Database Technologies -- DDL, DML,PL/SQL or relevant DB code
Demonstrate the ability to fix at least 10 code scan issues (High/Medium) like CodeQL and SonarQube .
Ensure code quality by designing at least 3 different test cases for each functionality. Execute testing using the JUnit framework while ensuring at least two pull requests are accepted.
Demonstrate proactive help to another team member in issue resolution. Find opportunities to share knowledge in a team environment.
Create how-to technology documentation and ensure traceability.

9675a939-d1df-4885-9864-4df6abce3820.description: The OWASP Top 10 Awareness badge represents a general understanding of the OWASP Top 10 Security Vulnerabilities, and the methods employed to protect against them. All engineers will be able to write and test more secure code by being aware of the OWASP Top 10.
9675a939-d1df-4885-9864-4df6abce3820.name: OWASP Top 10 Awareness

badge_template_activities.title: Complete/pass courses for "OWASP Top 10 Awareness" in Percipio.
Pass the "OWASP Top 10 Awareness (Entry Level)​" assessment with a score of proficient (70 or better)​.

71496387-2612-49ad-b992-768e50cd39e8.description: The OWASP Top 10 Competency badge represents a more in-depth understanding of the OWASP Top 10 Security Vulnerabilities, and the methods employed to protect against them. Engineers earning this badge will be well equipped to perform security-related tasks such as threat modeling and penetration testing.
71496387-2612-49ad-b992-768e50cd39e8.name: OWASP Top 10 Competency

badge_template_activities.title: Complete/pass courses for "OWASP Top 10 Competency " in Percipio.
Pass the "OWASP Top 10 Competency (Intermediate Level)​" assessment with a score of proficient (70 or better).

da25dd63-8244-4c6a-8819-bed892c9b532.description: The Performance Engineer ADVANCED badge represents a proficiency as a Performance Engineer who helps to improve the reliability of software applications and IT systems. They also work to improve the performance of these applications and systems by finding better ways to develop the product and fixing existing issues. Performance engineers assist throughout the entire development cycle to ensure optimal performance of the finished product.
da25dd63-8244-4c6a-8819-bed892c9b532.name: Performance Engineer - ADVANCED

badge_template_activities.title: Completed/ Passed foundational training.
Completed/ Passed Intermediate training.
Completed/ Passed "Performance Engineer Advanced" training in Percipio.
3 years of relevant Hands-On experience as a Performance Engineer
2 years' experience of utilizing a monitoring tool such as Dynatrace, NewRelic for data analysis and debugging.

Submit a case study to Evaluation Panel for review demonstrating competency in the following areas: Explain the performance requirements of the application, walk through strategy and design of performance testing, examples of complex script code to attain a special requirement of testing, share a case of resolving an application performance issue, include an example of how you grew your skills outside of performance engineering.

e7850247-38a4-4be5-a162-957582efc98f.description: The Performance Engineer INTERMEDIATE badge represents a proficiency as a Performance Engineer who helps to improve the reliability of software applications and IT systems. They also work to improve the performance of these applications and systems by finding better ways to develop the product and fixing existing issues. Performance engineers assist throughout the entire development cycle to ensure optimal performance of the finished product.
e7850247-38a4-4be5-a162-957582efc98f.name: Performance Engineer - Intermediate

badge_template_activities.title: Completed/ Passed foundational training.
Completed/ Passed "Performance Engineer Intermediate" training in Percipio.
2 years of relevant Hands-On experience as a Performance Engineer

1-year experience of utilizing a monitoring tool for debugging/analysis such as Dynatrace, Splunk, Elastic APM or any other tools. Share a case study of how you used monitoring from one of your projects.

Demonstrate competency in following areas by sharing examples: Performance test strategy based on business requirements, Test design, test environment and execution strategy, Results analysis, identifying a bottleneck and resolution.

80d640ca-96b9-4c4e-b852-b3aa3379dd7c.description: The Performance Engineer NOVICE badge represents a proficiency as a Performance Engineer who helps to improve the reliability of software applications and IT systems. They also work to improve the performance of these applications and systems by finding better ways to develop the product and fixing existing issues. Performance engineers assist throughout the entire development cycle to ensure optimal performance of the finished product.
80d640ca-96b9-4c4e-b852-b3aa3379dd7c.name: Performance Engineer - Novice

badge_template_activities.title: Completed/ Passed "Performance Engineer Foundation" training in Percipio.
1 year of relevant Hands-On experience as a Performance Engineer
Demonstrate basic scripting competency by providing an example that includes Transaction naming, Parameterization, Correlation Response validation / Error handling.

9c1c78f4-bbc8-480e-98b5-9a2655dd423a.description: The SDET ADVANCED badge represents a proficiency as a Software Development Engineer in Test. These individuals may work in either software development or software testing but typically work on the quality assurance (QA) team. SDETs write code like developers, but their code often focuses on testing automation, allowing for quicker testing results throughout development. Requirements for the SDET Novice and Intermediate badges must be completed before earning this badge.
9c1c78f4-bbc8-480e-98b5-9a2655dd423a.name: SDET - Advanced

badge_template_activities.title: Completed/ Passed foundational training in Percipio.
Completed/ Passed SDET intermediate training in Percipio.
Complete/pass courses for SDET advanced training in Percipio.
3 years of relevant hands-on experience as a SDET
Create 100 cucumber feature by automating complex scenario UI/API/Batch/MQ by creating at least 50 new step definition and modifying 50 existing step definition.
Support teams with issues and help resolve.
Create new utility or create new functionality for improving current process.
Create test automation strategy and provide to the team members.
Showcase FF that were created to Manager or appointed Tech person who can evaluate.

4d143c88-600d-41d7-a6eb-364a1043904a.description: The SDET INTERMEDIATE badge represents a proficiency as a Software Development Engineer in Test. These individuals may work in either software development or software testing but typically work on the quality assurance (QA) team. SDETs write code like developers, but their code often focuses on testing automation, allowing for quicker testing results throughout development. Requirements for the SDET Novice badge must be completed before receiving this badge.
4d143c88-600d-41d7-a6eb-364a1043904a.name: SDET - Intermediate

badge_template_activities.title: Completed/ Passed SDET Foundational Training in Percipio​.
Complete/pass courses for "SDET Intermediate Training" in Percipio​.
2 years of relevant Hands-On experience as a SDET
Create 50 cucumber feature by automating complex scenario UI/API/Batch/MQ by creating at least 25 new step definition and modifying 25 existing step definition.
Support teams with issues and help resolve.
Support major changes needed to maintain the projects - ex: UI mod/Smoke/Regression suite.
Showcase FF that were created to Manager or appointed Tech person who can evaluate.

266672b8-c9f7-4bd0-b285-ad7d175887bf.description: The SDET NOVICE badge represents a proficiency as a Software Development Engineer in Test. These individuals may work in either software development or software testing but typically work on the quality assurance (QA) team. SDETs write code like developers, but their code often focuses on testing automation, allowing for quicker testing results throughout development.
266672b8-c9f7-4bd0-b285-ad7d175887bf.name: SDET - Novice

badge_template_activities.title: Complete/Pass courses for "SDET Foundation Training" in Percipio.
1 year of relevant hands-on experience as a SDET.
Create 20 cucumber features by automating any scenario UI/API/Batch/MQ by creating at least 10 new step definition and modifying 10 existing step definition.
Clone Git projects and maintain branch.
Resolve merge issues with help from expert.
Manage test data sheets.
Showcase FF that were created to Manager or appointed Tech person who can evaluate.

bb6073c1-642a-481e-b637-31de2aafd3e7.description: This badge represents a System Analyst's proficiency of their FOUNDATIONAL knowledge in analyzing elicitation results and finding the best possible way to document them in the form of system requirements. Skills include ability to understand future state, identify and recommend solutions, identify impacts of proposed application changes, translate desired state into functional and non-functional system requirements, and write detailed, clear, high quality system requirements.
bb6073c1-642a-481e-b637-31de2aafd3e7.name: Systems Analysis: Requirements Analysis, Design and Documentation - Practical

badge_template_activities.title: They should be able to: 1) Understand difference of functional and non-functional requirements and how they are documented. 2) Quickly develop a high-level understanding of the application system and external influencers that pertain to an assigned project. 3) Understand most business requirements/user stories and what falls in scope within the project. 4) Understand recommended design/architecture, and current state vs future state, for simple projects. (CONTINUED)

5) Identify system requirement impacts on current state for simple projects with the help of peers or supervisor. 6) Identify where to make requirement changes or type of document needed with the help of peers or supervisor. 7) Perform simple analysis to answer basic system questions. 8) Demonstrate basic knowledge of tools used for analysis and documentation (Polarion, SQL Developer, SharePoint). 9) Consistently adhere to application documentation standards and SA processes. (CONTINUED)

10) Demonstrate basic knowledge of types of documentation utilized (use cases, B2Bs, interface diagrams, use case diagrams, process flows). 11) Write clear and concise simple requirements for small to medium projects.
Measured by:
Creation of requirement documentation containing both functional and non-functional requirements.
Can perform many of the tasks required to analyze and refine elicitation results into system requirements and designs with support of others.
Demonstrates adherence to application SA standards and processes on all assigned projects.
Utilize more than one type of analysis techniques to answer system related questions or determine requirement impacts.
Utilize more than one type of documentation in writing requirements (use case, B2B, etc).
Utilizes more than one of the following SA tools for an assigned project of simple (Polarion, SharePoint, SQL Navigator).
Successfully complete multiple (2+) SA assignments for simple to medium projects, delivering high quality results and writing new requirements for at least one of the assignments.

e22eae0e-8e5f-44dd-8892-5be1d5966219.description: This badge represents a System Analyst's proficiency of their INTERMEDIATE knowledge in analyzing elicitation results and finding the best possible way to document them in the form of system requirements. Skills include ability to understand future state, identify and recommend solutions, identify impacts of proposed application changes, translate desired state into functional and non-functional system requirements, and write detailed, clear, high quality system requirements.
e22eae0e-8e5f-44dd-8892-5be1d5966219.name: Systems Analysis: Requirements Analysis, Design and Documentation​ - Proficient

badge_template_activities.title: They should be able to: 1) Demonstrate a proficient level of understanding of most system applications and external influencers. 2) Understand all business requirements/user stories and what falls in scope within the project. 3) Understand recommended design/architecture for all level projects and recommend/influence design for simple to medium projects. 4) Independently identify system requirement impacts, where to make changes, and document types needed for all level projects. (CONTINUED)

5) Identifies requirement inconsistencies, poor quality requirements, and incorrect requirements in existing documentation and makes corrections for the good of the document. 6) Perform analysis to answer most system questions and solve simple production issues. 7) Make self known as “go to” resource for questions on some systems and SA processes. 8) Demonstrate in depth knowledge of tools used for analysis and documentation (Polarion, SQL Developer, SharePoints). (CONTINUED)

9) Demonstrate in depth knowledge of types of documentation utilized (use cases, B2Bs, interface diagrams, use case diagrams, process flows). 10) Write clear and concise complex requirements for medium to large projects. 11) Independently handles multiple projects (of mixed sizes) at one time. 12) Demonstrate ability to consistently produce high quality documentation of all forms.
Measured by:
Can independently perform many of the tasks required to analyze and refine elicitation results into system requirements and designs for medium to complex projects.
Utilize more than one type of analysis techniques to answer complex system related questions or determine requirement impacts for a medium to complex project.
Demonstrate involvement is system design on a project.
Show an instance of requirement clean up or rewrite not related to an assigned project.
Create a completely new system requirement document, rather than just updating existing documents, for 2 types of system documentation (use case, B2B, etc).
Demonstrate proficient use of SA tools for documenting and analysis (Polarion, SharePoint, SQL Navigator).
Shows evidence of being considered a “go to” resources in at least 2 topics.
Independently complete multiple (2+) SA assignments for medium to complex projects, delivering high quality results while working on other assignments during time frame.

31cb7e97-b1d0-4833-92d7-29619d06adb5.description: This badge represents a System Analyst's proficiency of their ADVANCED knowledge in analyzing elicitation results and finding the best possible way to document them in the form of system requirements. Skills include ability to understand future state, identify and recommend solutions, identify impacts of proposed application changes, translate desired state into functional and non-functional system requirements, and write detailed, clear, high quality system requirements.
31cb7e97-b1d0-4833-92d7-29619d06adb5.name: Systems Analysis: Requirements Analysis, Design and Documentation - Strategic

badge_template_activities.title: They should be able to: 1) Demonstrate an advanced level of understanding of most system applications and external influencers. 2) Provide estimates of system impacts. 3) Consistently recommend and influence design/architecture for medium to highly complex level projects. 4) Consistently identify roadblocks/issues that might lead to a negative impact and recommend solutions. 5) Independently handles multiple complex projects at one time. (CONTINUED)

6) Identifies poor quality documents and will rewrite or reorganize large parts of documents for the good of the document. 7) Make self known as “go to” resource for questions on most systems and all SA processes. 8) Perform analysis to answer complex system questions and solve complex production issues. 9) Train others on tools, recommend new tools, and provide support of existing tools used by SAs. (CONTINUED)

10) Train others how to identify system requirement impacts and identify where to make requirement changes. 11) Train others on types of documentation utilized (use cases, B2Bs, interface diagrams, use case diagrams, process flows). 12) Recommend new ways of documenting requirements. 13) Recommend new documentation standards and SA processes. 14) Interview and evaluate resources to hire as SAs or evaluate performance of entry level SAs.
Measured by the following:
Utilize more than one type of analysis techniques to answer complex system related questions or solve a production issue.
Demonstrate influence of system design and recommendation of a design option on at least 1 project.
Show evidence of being considered a “go to” resources across most applications.
Independently complete multiple (2+) SA assignments for complex projects at the same time, delivering high quality results.
Create new method of system documentation or analysis.
Recommend a new SA standard or process improvement.
Train and mentor at least one resource in all aspects of being an SA (tools, analysis and documenting).
Participate in the interviewing process for at least one candidate.

c68be475-8553-477d-ace0-12ea295d8f1c.description: This badge represents a System Analyst's proficiency of their FOUNDATIONAL knowledge in the activities associated with requirements elicitation and collaboration with business and technical stakeholders to identify system requirements. Skills include ability to understand difference between current and future state, use of elicitation documentation materials and techniques, facilitation of requirement gathering activities, and keeping stakeholders focused on MVP.
c68be475-8553-477d-ace0-12ea295d8f1c.name: Systems Analysis: Requirements Elicitation and Collaboration - Practical

badge_template_activities.title: 1) Independently prepare for simple elicitation activities; relies on support from others in more complex situations. 2) Rely on others to manage elicitation activity logistics. 3) Have an awareness of common elicitation techniques including Brainstorming, Document Analysis, Interviewing, Requirement Gathering Sessions, and Scenario Analysis. 4) Can elicit information relevant to the change with support of others. 5) Capture the outcomes of the elicitation activity.
Measured by:
Set up elicitation meeting(s) with stakeholders with little to no help for 2-4 stakeholders.
Utilize(s) one or more of the following elicitation techniques: Brainstorming, Documentation Analysis, Interviewing, Requirement Gathering Sessions, Scenario Analysis.
Capture system requirements within 2-4 iterations.
Create simple supporting requirement materials as needed (Activity Diagrams, Process Flows, Conceptual Diagrams, Use Cases, B2Bs, Requirement Matrixes) with help from peers or supervisor.
Provide action items during elicitation meetings with deadlines.
Can handle 1-2 small, less complex projects/features at a time, eliciting simple requirements.

84ce857e-3121-4bb7-8066-57139a9d464b.description: This badge represents a System Analyst's proficiency of their INTERMEDIATE knowledge in the activities associated with requirements elicitation and collaboration with business and technical stakeholders to identify system requirements. Skills include ability to understand difference between current and future state, use of elicitation documentation materials and techniques, facilitation of requirement gathering activities, and keeping stakeholders focused on MVP.
84ce857e-3121-4bb7-8066-57139a9d464b.name: Systems Analysis: Requirements Elicitation and Collaboration - Proficient

badge_template_activities.title: 1) Select appropriate elicitation techniques on own. 2) Prepare supporting materials to convey information and elicit requirements: (Activity Diagrams, Process Flows, Conceptual Diagrams, Use Cases, B2Bs, Requirement Matrixes). (CONTINUED)

3) Prepare stakeholders in advance of elicitation sessions to ensure activities run smoothly and everyone works toward a common goal using methods such as: gaining agreement for required stakeholder commitments, monitoring stakeholder engagement and collaboration, demonstrating collaborative relationships with key stakeholders. 4) Organize activities and manage time efficiently to consistently adhere to commitments and changing priorities. (CONTINUED)

5) Use common elicitation techniques (Brainstorming, Document Analysis, Interviewing, Requirement Gathering Sessions, Scenario Analysis). 6) Control elicitation sessions to elicit information relevant to the change. 7) Adapt verbal and non-verbal communication style to the needs of the situation and the individual. 8) Use active listening and discovery skills to understand “real” issues/needs and build rapport. (CONTINUED)
9) Use facilitation skills to encourage participation from all attendees. 10) Influence others to drive action. 11) Manage and track issues and follow-ups that result from elicitation sessions.
Measured by:
Articulate the scope of the project as it relates to system requirements.
Set up elicitation meeting(s) with no help for 4-8 stakeholders.
Utilize more than one of the following elicitation techniques: Brainstorming, Documentation Analysis, Interviewing, Requirement Gathering Sessions, Scenario Analysis
Capture system requirements within 1 - 2 iterations.
Create supporting requirement materials as needed (Activity Diagrams, Process Flows, Conceptual Diagrams, Use Cases, B2Bs, Requirement Matrixes) with minor help from peers or supervisor.
Keep stakeholders focused on MVP items.
Can handle multiple projects/features of “medium size” and complexity, eliciting somewhat complex requirements.

9e5836c3-9363-4479-a3a8-b6ed9ff2c2cf.description: This badge represents a System Analyst's proficiency of their ADVANCED knowledge in the activities associated with requirements elicitation and collaboration with business and technical stakeholders to identify system requirements. Skills include ability to understand difference between current and future state, use of elicitation documentation materials and techniques, facilitation of requirement gathering activities, and keeping stakeholders focused on MVP.
9e5836c3-9363-4479-a3a8-b6ed9ff2c2cf.name: Systems Analysis: Requirements Elicitation and Collaboration - Strategic

badge_template_activities.title: They should be able to: 1) Create elicitation support material templates for others to use. 2) Develop approaches and tactics for developing greater organizational understanding. 3) Consistently prepare for complex elicitation activities. 4) Foster a collaborative approach to encourage feedback, opinions and acceptance towards the use of elicitation tools and templates for personal planning and organization. (CONTINUED)

5) Have been sought for advice, support and training by others on ways to effectively prepare for elicitation. 6) Quickly understand team capabilities and skill/knowledge gaps. 7) Evaluate what worked in previous elicitation activities, what did not, and what could be done differently next time. 8) Anticipate possible delays and proactively ask for assistance in reprioritizing. (CONTINUED)

9) Work with large or multiple teams that span functions, issues, locations, and time zones to coordinate roles, responsibilities and interdependencies of all team member. 10) Support others with complex elicitation activities. 11) Guide others on how to effectively use common elicitation techniques. 12) Lead others in elicitation activities. 13) Consistently uncover emotional drivers of stakeholders and develop messaging accordingly. (CONTINUED)

14) Develop nontraditional ideas for elicitation techniques. 15) Consistently find “common ground” between differing viewpoints. 16) Define strategies and plans for influencing multiple decision makers. 17) Manage and track issues and follow-ups that result from elicitation sessions. 18) Coordinate the resolution of issues.
Measured by:
Maintains the scope of the project as it relates to system requirements.
Hold elicitation meetings with >10 stakeholders.
Capture system requirements within 1 - 2 iterations.
Utilize more than one of the following elicitation techniques: Brainstorming, Documentation Analysis, Interviewing, Requirement Gathering Session, Scenario Analysis
Create supporting requirement materials as needed (Activity Diagrams, Process Flows, Conceptual Diagrams, Use Cases, B2Bs, Requirement Matrixes) with no help from peers or supervisor.
Keep stakeholders within MVP items.
Provide support to junior SAs with more complex elicitation techniques.
Handle multiple complex projects/feature requests at the same time, eliciting complex requirements.
